item.title: Super increase will cost you a pay rise
item.description: A Melbourne-based think tank says the planned increase in compulsory superannuation contributions will come at the expense of future wage growth, exacerbating the economic shock caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Couple high on ice ‘terrorise’ man
item.description: A mum has broken down in tears while listening in court to how she and her partner barged into a farmer’s home and threatened him with a nail gun before hitting him 10 times around the head and stealing his phone, iPad, and cash.

item.title: ‘Bit of hope’ as ASX closes higher
item.description: The Australian share market closed in the green on Thursday, driven by relief that Victoria’s daily COVID-19 numbers were lower than yesterday’s record high and positive leads from most overseas markets.

item.title: Girl’s ‘different personality’ after virus
item.description: A British teenager diagnosed with an inflammatory disorder associated with COVID-19 developed severe neurological conditions that left her with a “completely different personality”.

item.title: Horror attack: Man thought mum was alien
Bennett has a dig at Broncos over Boyd
item.description: South Sydney coach Wayne Bennett has taken a subtle dig at Brisbane for not moving proven performer Darius Boyd to fullback earlier in the season.

item.title: Vic businesses push for looser shutdown
item.description: The Victorian Government has added metal fabrication to its complicated list of businesses that can operate under stage four COVID-19 restrictions and is now being called on to allow around-the-clock work permits for certain jobs.

item.title: Opera House sails off Kings logo after 30 years
item.description: The Sydney Kings look set to part ways with the franchise’s iconic Opera House sails logo due to IP issues with the Opera House Trust.

item.title: How corrupt staffer ripped off schools
item.description: A high-ranking Department of Education employee is awaiting his fate after using his position to pocket taxpayer money in a corrupt and complex scheme.

item.title: Kingpin Bassam Hamzy’s prison complaint
item.description: Infamous criminal kingpin Bassam Hamzy has blamed his numerous legal battles for a mix-up in which his lawyer mistakenly told a court he was ready for a hearing when he wasn’t.
